page.title: 08The farming year
page.content: In{September and November}the local arable farmer prepares his land with the plough and the cultivator.When this has been completed, he is able to sow seed for the rape, barley and wheat crops. {December and January}are mainly devoted to the maintenance of buildings and machinery.Ditches, hedges and drains also receive any necessary attention. From{March to June,}the growing crops are sprayed against diseases and fertilisers are added to the land. The months of{July and August}are very busy for the farmer as this is the time for harvesting the crops of oil-seed rape, barley, peas, wheat and lupin. Immediately after harvest, ploughing begins and a new farming year is underway.
